definitions.definition: Saturday, observed in Judaism and some Christian denominations as a day of rest and worship.
Sunday, observed in most of Christianity as a day of rest and worship.
Friday, observed in Islam as a day of rest and worship.
definitions.example: There are three Sabbaths–Friday (Muslim), Saturday (Jewish), and Sunday (Christian).

definitions.definition: A meeting of witches. (Also called a witches' sabbath, sabbat or black sabbath.)
Among the ancient Jews and Hebrews, the seventh year, when the land was left fallow.
An extended period of leave from a person's usual pursuits.
Relating to the Sabbath / sabbath.
Relating to a sabbatical.
The evergreen shrub Juniperus sabina, endemic to Europe, which yields a medicinal oil.
The poisonous dried tips of this plant, with anthelmintic properties, used as a drug.
The eastern red cedar, Juniperus virginiana, of eastern North America.
A small carnivorous mammal of the Old World that resembles a weasel, Martes zibellina, from cold regions in Eurasia and the North Pacific islands, valued for its dark brown fur (Wikipedia).
The marten, especially Martes americana (syn. Mustela americana).
The fur or pelt of the sable or other species of martens; a coat made from this fur.
An artist's brush made from the fur of the sable (Wikipedia).
A black colour on a coat of arms (Wikipedia).
A dark brown colour, resembling the fur of some sables.
(in the plural, sables) Black garments, especially worn in mourning.
Of the black colour sable.
: In blazon, of the colour black.
Made of sable fur.
Dark, somber.
Dark-skinned; black.
A deliberate action aimed at weakening an enemy through subversion, obstruction, disruption, and/or destruction.

An act or acts with intent to injure, interfere with, or obstruct the national defense of a country by willfully injuring or destroying, or attempting to injure or destroy, any national defense or war materiel, premises, or utilities, to include human and natural resources.
To deliberately destroy or damage something in order to prevent it from being successful.
definitions.example: The railway line had been sabotaged by enemy commandos.

definitions.definition: A native-born Israeli.
Sentimentalism
Of or relating to sugar.
Excessively sweet in action or disposition; syrupy.
Sentimental or romantic to the point of ridiculousness.
Of or relating to saccharin.
The chief of a Native American tribe; a sagamore.
A leader in the Tammany Hall society.

A bag; especially a large bag of strong, coarse material for storage and handling of various commodities, such as potatoes, coal, coffee; or, a bag with handles used at a supermarket, a grocery sack; or, a small bag for small items, a satchel.

The amount a sack holds; also, an archaic or historical measure of varying capacity, depending on commodity type and according to local usage; an old English measure of weight, usually of wool, equal to 13 stone (182 pounds), or in other sources, 26 stone (364 pounds).
definitions.example: The American sack of salt is 215 pounds; the sack of wheat, two bushels. — McElrath.

definitions.definition: The plunder and pillaging of a captured town or city.
definitions.example: The sack of Rome.

definitions.definition: Loot or booty obtained by pillage.
A successful tackle of the quarterback behind the line of scrimmage. See verb sense4 below.
One of the square bases anchored at first base, second base, or third base.
definitions.example: He twisted his ankle sliding into the sack at second.

definitions.definition: Dismissal from employment, or discharge from a position, usually as give (someone) the sack or get the sack. See verb sense5 below.
definitions.example: He got the sack for being late all the time.

definitions.definition: Bed; usually as hit the sack or in the sack. See also sack out.

(also sacque) A kind of loose-fitting gown or dress with sleeves which hangs from the shoulders, such as a gown with a Watteau back or sack-back, fashionable in the late 17th to 18th century; or, formerly, a loose-fitting hip-length jacket, cloak or cape.
A sack coat; a kind of coat worn by men, and extending from top to bottom without a cross seam.
The scrotum.
definitions.example: He got passed the ball, but it hit him in the sack.

definitions.definition: To put in a sack or sacks.
definitions.example: Help me sack the groceries.

definitions.definition: To bear or carry in a sack upon the back or the shoulders.
To plunder or pillage, especially after capture; to obtain spoils of war from.
definitions.example: The barbarians sacked Rome.

definitions.definition: To tackle the quarterback behind the line of scrimmage, especially before he is able to throw a pass.
To discharge from a job or position; to fire.
definitions.example: He was sacked last September.

definitions.definition: In the phrase sack out, to fall asleep. See also hit the sack.
definitions.example: The kids all sacked out before 9:00 on New Year’s Eve.

definitions.definition: A variety of light-colored dry wine from Spain or the Canary Islands; also, any strong white wine from southern Europe; sherry.
A bag or pouch inside a plant or animal that typically contains a fluid.
(games) A sacrifice.
definitions.example: Kasparov's queen sac early in the game gained him a positional advantage against Kramnik.

definitions.definition: The privilege, formerly enjoyed by the lord of a manor, of holding courts, trying causes, and imposing fines.
A bag or pouch inside a plant or animal that typically contains a fluid.
(games) A sacrifice.
definitions.example: Kasparov's queen sac early in the game gained him a positional advantage against Kramnik.

definitions.definition: (games) To sacrifice.
definitions.example: I kept saccing monsters at the altar until I was rewarded with a new weapon.

definitions.definition: The privilege, formerly enjoyed by the lord of a manor, of holding courts, trying causes, and imposing fines.
Any of the sacral bones that make up the sacrum.
Of the sacrum.
Sacred.
A sacred act or ceremony in Christianity. In Catholic theology, a sacrament is defined as "an outward sign instituted by Christ to give grace."
(in particular) The Eucharist.
The consecrated Eucharist (especially the bread).
A thing which is regarded as possessing a sacred character or mysterious significance.
The oath of allegiance taken by soldiers in Ancient Rome; hence, any sacred ceremony used to impress an obligation; a solemn oath-taking; an oath.
To bind by an oath.
The offering of anything to a god; a consecratory rite.
The destruction or surrender of anything for the sake of something else; the devotion of something desirable to something higher, or to a calling deemed more pressing.
definitions.example: the sacrifice of one's spare time in order to volunteer

definitions.definition: Something sacrificed.
A loss of profit.
A sale at a price less than the cost or the actual value.
To offer (something) as a gift to a deity.
To give away (something valuable) to get at least a possibility of gaining something else of value (such as self-respect, trust, love, freedom, prosperity), or to avoid an even greater loss.
definitions.example: Venison has many advantages over meat from factory farms, although it still requires a hunter to sacrifice the life of a deer.

definitions.definition: To trade (a value of higher worth) for something of lesser worth in order to gain something else valued more, such as an ally or business relationship, or to avoid an even greater loss; to sell without profit to gain something other than money.
To intentionally give up (a piece) in order to improve one’s position on the board.
To advance (a runner on base) by batting the ball so it can be caught or fielded, placing the batter out, but with insufficient time to put the runner out.
To sell at a price less than the cost or actual value.
To destroy; to kill.
Relating to sacrifice
definitions.example: The old sacrificial well is still there, but animals aren't thrown into it to appease monsters anymore.

definitions.definition: Used as a sacrifice.
definitions.example: The ceremony involves the ritual slaying of a sacrificial lamb.

definitions.definition: Desecration, profanation, misuse or violation of something regarded as sacred.
Committing sacrilege; acting or speaking very disrespectfully toward what is held to be sacred.
The person who maintains the sacristy and the sacred objects it contains.
Beyond alteration, criticism, or interference, especially due to religious sanction; inviolable.
Sacred, very holy.
To make sad or unhappy.
definitions.example: It saddens me to think that I might have hurt someone.

definitions.definition: To become sad or unhappy.
To darken a color during dyeing.
To render heavy or cohesive.
A seat (tack) for a rider placed on the back of a horse or other animal.
An item of harness (harness saddle) placed on the back of a horse or other animal.
A seat on a bicycle, motorcycle, etc.
A cut of meat that includes both loins and part of the backbone.
A low point, in the shape of a saddle, between two hills.
A formation of gold-bearing quartz occurring along the crest of an anticlinal fold, especially in Australia.
The raised floorboard in a doorway.
A small tapered or sloped area structure that helps channel surface water to drains.
A block of wood, usually fastened to one spar and shaped to receive the end of another.
A part, such as a flange, which is hollowed out to fit upon a convex surface and serve as a means of attachment or support.
The clitellum of an earthworm.
Any of the saddle-like markings on a boa constrictor.
A saddle shoe.
To put a saddle on (an animal).
To get into a saddle.
To burden or encumber.
definitions.example: He has been saddled with the task of collecting evidence of the theft.

definitions.definition: A covered pouch, usually one of a pair, laid across the back of a horse, donkey, or mule behind its saddle, or hanging over the rear wheel of a bicycle or motorcycle; often made of leather or (on a bicycle or motorcycle) a rigid material.
(in the plural) Loose fatty flesh on a person's upper thighs or buttocks, that hangs like saddlebags.
A style of house with two rooms separated by a small hall and open space.
The enjoyment of inflicting pain or humiliation without pity.
Achievement of sexual gratification by inflicting pain or humiliation on others, or watching pain or humiliation inflicted on others.
(in general) Deliberate cruelty, either mental or physical, to other people, or to animals, regardless of whether for (sexual) gratification.
One who derives pleasure through cruelty or pain to others.
A trip into any undeveloped area to see, photograph or hunt wild animals in their own environment.
A caravan going on a safari.
To take part in a safari.
A box, usually made of metal, in which valuables can be locked for safekeeping.
A condom.
A ventilated or refrigerated chest or closet for securing provisions from noxious animals or insects.
A safety bicycle.
To make something safe.
Not in danger; out of harm's reach.
definitions.example: You’ll be safe here.

definitions.definition: Free from risk.
definitions.example: It’s safe to eat this.

definitions.definition: Providing protection from danger; providing shelter.
definitions.example: We have to find a safe spot, where we can hide out until this is over.

definitions.definition: When a batter successfully reaches first base, or when a baserunner successfully advances to the next base or returns to the base he last occupied; not out.
definitions.example: The pitcher attempted to pick off the runner at first, but he was safe.

definitions.definition: Properly secured.
definitions.example: The documents are safe.

definitions.definition: (used after a noun, often forming a compound) Not susceptible to a specified source of harm.
definitions.example: dishwasher-safe

definitions.definition: Great, cool, awesome, respectable; a term of approbation, often as interjection.
Lenient, usually describing a teacher that is easy-going.
Reliable; trusty.
Cautious.
Of a programming language, type-safe or more generally offering well-defined behavior despite programming errors.
Something that serves as a guard or protection; a defense.
definitions.example: Getting a flu shot is a good safeguard against illness.

definitions.definition: One who, or that which, defends or protects; defence; protection.
A safe-conduct or passport, especially in time of war.
The monitor lizard.
To protect, to keep safe.
definitions.example: She kept a savings to safeguard against debt and emergencies.

definitions.definition: To escort safely.
The act of keeping something safe; protection from harm, damage, loss, or theft
The storage of assets in a protected area
The responsibility of a guardian
Not returning checks; a system wherein banks keep checks (cheques) that people write, rather than returning them to the account holder with their monthly statement.
The condition or feeling of being safe; security; certainty.
definitions.example: If you push it to the limit, safety is not guaranteed.

definitions.definition: A mechanism on a weapon or dangerous equipment designed to prevent accidental firing.
definitions.example: Be sure that the safety is set before proceeding.

definitions.definition: An instance of a player being sacked or tackled in the end zone, or stepping out of the end zone and off the field, resulting in two points to the opposite team.
definitions.example: He sacked the quarterback in the end zone for a safety.

definitions.definition: Any of the defensive players who are in position furthest from the line of scrimmage and whose responsibility is to defend against passes as well as to be the tacklers of last resort.
definitions.example: The free safety made a game-saving tackle on the runner who had broken past the linebackers.

definitions.definition: A safety squeeze.
Preservation from escape; close custody.
A safety bicycle.
To secure (a mechanical component, as in aviation) to keep it from becoming detached even under vibration.
To secure a firing pin, as in guns, to keep the gun from firing
The plant Crocus sativus, a crocus.
A spice (seasoning) and colouring agent made from the stigma and part of the style of the plant, sometimes or formerly also used as a dye and insect repellent.
An orange-yellow colour, the colour of a lion's pelt.
To add saffron to (a food), for taste, colour etc.
definitions.example: saffroned water, saffroned rice.

definitions.definition: To give a saffron colour to (something).
To embellish.
Having an orange-yellow colour.
definitions.example: The saffron robe of a Buddhist monk.

definitions.definition: An Old Norse (Icelandic) prose narrative, especially one dealing with family or social histories and legends.
Something with the qualities of such a saga; an epic, a long story.
Having or showing keen discernment, sound judgment, and farsightedness; mentally shrewd.
Keen sense of smell.
The quality of being sage, wise, or able to make good decisions; the quality of being perceptive, astute or insightful.
A wise person or spiritual teacher; someone of gravity and wisdom, especially, a teacher venerable for years, and of sound judgment and prudence; a grave or stoic philosopher.
Wise.
Grave; serious; solemn
The plant Salvia officinalis and savory spice produced from it; also planted for ornamental purposes.
Any plant in the genus Salvia
Any of a number of plants such as sagebrush considered to be similar to Salvia officinalis, mostly because they are small shrubs and have gray foliage or are aromatic.
The act of using the word or option sage in the email field or a checkbox of an imageboard when posting a reply.
definitions.example: Reminder to sage and report.

definitions.definition: Word used in the email field of imageboards to prevent a bump of the post. Used as an option rather than a word in some imageboard software.
definitions.example: sage in all fields

definitions.definition: Any of several North American aromatic shrubs of the genus Artemisia, having silvery-grey, green leaves.
To sink, in the middle, by its weight or under applied pressure, below a horizontal line or plane.
definitions.example: A line or cable supported by its ends sags, even if it is tightly drawn.

definitions.definition: (by extension) To lean, give way, or settle from a vertical position.
definitions.example: A building may sag one way or another.

definitions.definition: To lose firmness, elasticity, vigor, or a thriving state; to sink; to droop; to flag; to bend; to yield, as the mind or spirits, under the pressure of care, trouble, doubt, or the like; to be unsettled or unbalanced.
To loiter in walking; to idle along; to drag or droop heavily.
To cause to bend or give way; to load.
To wear one's trousers so that their top is well below the waist.
The act of something that sags.
A manner of wearing pants or shorts below the waist, revealing some or all of the underwear.
(of a person or clothes) Worn low on the waist, or wearing pants or shorts low on the waist.
In the direction from dorsal to ventral.
Of or relating to an arrow; resembling an arrow; furnished with an arrow-like appendage.
A powdered starch obtained from certain palms used as a food thickener.
A similar starch obtained from a palm-like cycad, Cycas revoluta
Any of the palms from which sago is extracted.
Carnegiea gigantea, a large cactus native to the Sonoran Desert and characterized by its "arms".
Mentioned earlier; aforesaid.
definitions.example: The said party has denied the charges.

definitions.definition: To pronounce.
definitions.example: Please say your name slowly and clearly.

definitions.definition: To recite.
definitions.example: Martha, will you say the Pledge of Allegiance?

definitions.definition: To tell, either verbally or in writing.
definitions.example: He said he would be here tomorrow.

definitions.definition: To indicate in a written form.
definitions.example: The sign says it’s 50 kilometres to Paris.

definitions.definition: To have a common expression; used in singular passive voice or plural active voice to indicate a rumor or well-known fact.
definitions.example: They say "when in Rome, do as the Romans do", which means "behave as those around you do."

definitions.definition: Suppose, assume; used to mark an example, supposition or hypothesis.
definitions.example: A holiday somewhere warm – Florida, say – would be nice.

definitions.definition: To speak; to express an opinion; to make answer; to reply.
(of a possession, especially money) To bet as a wager on an outcome; by extension, used to express belief in an outcome by the speaker.
A piece of fabric attached to a boat and arranged such that it causes the wind to drive the boat along. The sail may be attached to the boat via a combination of mast, spars and ropes.
(nautical,uncountable) The concept of a sail or sails, as if a substance.
definitions.example: Take in sail: a storm is coming.

definitions.definition: The power harnessed by a sail or sails, or the use of this power for travel or transport.
A trip in a boat, especially a sailboat.
definitions.example: Let's go for a sail.

definitions.definition: (plural "sail") A sailing vessel; a vessel of any kind; a craft.
definitions.example: Twenty sail were in sight.

definitions.definition: The blade of a windmill.
A tower-like structure found on the dorsal (topside) surface of submarines.
The floating organ of siphonophores, such as the Portuguese man-of-war.
A sailfish.
definitions.example: We caught three sails today.

definitions.definition: An outward projection of the spine, occurring in certain dinosaurs and synapsids
Anything resembling a sail, such as a wing.
To be impelled or driven forward by the action of wind upon sails, as a ship on water; to be impelled on a body of water by steam or other power.
To move through or on the water; to swim, as a fish or a waterfowl.
To ride in a boat, especially a sailboat.
To set sail; to begin a voyage.
definitions.example: We sail for Australia tomorrow.

definitions.definition: To move briskly and gracefully through the air.
To move briskly.
definitions.example: The duchess sailed haughtily out of the room.

definitions.definition: A boat propelled by a sail.
A playing card with the rank of four.
A fish of the genus Istiophorus, having a characteristic sail-like fin on its back.
The basking shark.
The quillback.
A person in the business of navigating ships or other vessels
Someone knowledgeable in the practical management of ships.
definitions.example: He's a talented sailor and has spent many years at sea.

definitions.definition: A member of the crew of a vessel; a mariner; a common seaman.
A person who sails sailing boats as a sport or recreation.
Any of various nymphalid butterflies of the genera Neptis, Pseudoneptis and Phaedyma, having white markings on a dark base and commonly flying by gliding.
A person whom a church or another religious group has officially recognised as especially holy or godly; one eminent for piety and virtue.
definitions.example: Kateri Tekakwitha was proclaimed a saint.

definitions.definition: (by extension) A person with positive qualities; one who does good.
definitions.example: Dorothy Day was a living saint.

definitions.definition: One of the blessed in heaven.
A holy object.
To canonize, to formally recognize someone as a saint.
definitions.example: Many wish to see Pope John Paul II sainted immediately.

definitions.definition: Cause, interest or account
definitions.example: For the sake of argument

definitions.definition: Purpose or end; reason
definitions.example: For old times' sake

definitions.definition: The benefit or regard of someone or something
(obsolete except in phrases) contention, strife; guilt, sin, accusation or charge
An alcoholic beverage made from fermenting various forms of rice, usually with an ABV similar to wine.
A class of Japanese rice wines made from polished rice and typically about 20% alcohol by volume.
A low bow as a ceremonial act of deference.
To perform a salaam (to someone).
A respectful ceremonial greeting performed mostly in Islamic countries.
Promoting sexual desire or lust.
Lascivious, bawdy, obscene, lewd.
A food made primarily of a mixture of raw or cold ingredients, typically vegetables, usually served with a dressing such as vinegar or mayonnaise.
A raw vegetable of the kind used in salads.
A long, slender, chiefly terrestrial amphibian of the order Caudata, superficially resembling a lizard.
A creature much like a lizard that is resistant to and lives in fire (in which it is often depicted in heraldry), hence the elemental being of fire.
A metal utensil with a flat head which is heated and put over a dish to brown the top.
A small broiler (North America) or grill (Britain) that heats the food from above, used in professional cookery primarily for browning.
definitions.example: The chef first put the steak under the salamander to sear the outside.

definitions.definition: The pouched gopher, Geomys tuza, of the southern United States.
A large poker.
Solidified material in a furnace hearth.
Portable stove used to heat or dry buildings under construction.
To use a salamander (cooking utensil) in a cooking process.
A large cured meat sausage of Italian origin, served in slices.
A grand slam.
A penis.
A fixed amount of money paid to a worker, usually calculated on a monthly or annual basis, not hourly, as wages. Implies a degree of professionalism and/or autonomy.
To pay on the basis of a period of a week or longer, especially to convert from another form of compensation.
Saline.
A hall.
An exchange of goods or services for currency or credit.
definitions.example: He celebrated after the sale of company.

definitions.definition: (Short for discount sale) The sale of goods at reduced prices.
definitions.example: They are having a clearance sale: 50% off.

definitions.definition: The act of putting up for auction to the highest bidder.
A young woman employed as a salesclerk.
A woman who is employed as a salesclerk.
A man whose job it is to sell things, either in a shop/store or elsewhere.
A man whose job it is to sell things, either in a shop/store or elsewhere.
A person whose job is to sell things, either in a shop/store or elsewhere.
An outwardly projecting part of a fortification, trench system, or line of defense.
Worthy of note; pertinent or relevant.
definitions.example: The article is not exhaustive, but it covers the salient points pretty well.

definitions.definition: Prominent; conspicuous.
(usually of a quadruped) Depicted in a leaping posture.
definitions.example: a lion salient

definitions.definition: Projecting outwards, pointing outwards.
definitions.example: a salient angle

definitions.definition: Moving by leaps or springs; jumping.
Shooting or springing out; projecting.
Denoting any angle less than two right angles.
A salt marsh, or salt pond, enclosed from the sea.
Water containing dissolved salt.
A salt spring; a place where salt water is collected in the earth.
Containing salt; salty.
Resembling salt.
definitions.example: a saline taste

definitions.definition: A clear, slightly alkaline liquid secreted into the mouth by the salivary glands and mucous glands, consisting of water, mucin, protein, and enzymes. It moistens the mouth, lubricates ingested food, and begins the breakdown of starches.
A salivary gland.
Relating to saliva.
To produce saliva.
To show eager anticipation at the expectation of something.
definitions.example: He's been salivating over the latest model sports car for a while now.

definitions.definition: To become sallow.
To cause (someone or something) to become sallow.
(of skin) Yellowish.
(of a person) Having skin (especially on the face) of a sickly pale colour.
(of objects or dim light) Having a similar pale, yellowish colour.
Dirty; murky.
A European willow, Salix caprea, that has broad leaves, large catkins and tough wood.
A willow twig or branch.
A willow
Any tree that looks like a willow
An object made from the above trees' wood
A sortie of troops from a besieged place against an enemy.
A sudden rushing forth.
definitions.example: Flocks of these birds stir up flying insects, which can then be picked off in quick sallies.

definitions.definition: A witty statement or quip, usually at the expense of one's interlocutor.
An excursion or side trip.
A tufted woollen part of a bellrope, used to provide grip when ringing a bell.
To make a sudden attack (e.g. on an enemy from a defended position).
definitions.example: A feeding strategy of some birds is to sally out from a perch to snatch an insect and then returning to the same or a different perch.

definitions.definition: To set out on an excursion; venture; depart (often followed by "forth.")
definitions.example: As she sallied forth from her boudoir, you would never have guessed how quickly she could strip for action. - William Manchester

definitions.definition: To venture off the beaten path.
A member of the Salvation Army.
A kind of stonefly.
A wren.
One of several species of fish, typically of the Salmoninae subfamily, brownish above with silvery sides and delicate pinkish-orange flesh; they ascend rivers to spawn.
(plural salmons) A pale pinkish-orange colour, the colour of cooked salmon.
The upper bricks in a kiln which receive the least heat.
Snout (tobacco; from salmon and trout)
To ride a bicycle the wrong way down a one-way street.
Having a pale pinkish-orange colour.
A bush, Rubus spectabilis, found on the Pacific coast of North America.
The fruit from this bush, similar in appearance and texture to the blackberry and raspberry.
Any of several rod-shaped bacteria, of the genus Salmonella, that cause food poisoning and other diseases
definitions.example: Everyone got sick from salmonella in the undercooked meat.

definitions.definition: A large room, especially one used to receive and entertain guests.
A gathering of people for a social or intellectual meeting.
An art gallery or exhibition; especially the Paris salon or autumn salon.
A beauty salon or similar establishment.
A large room, especially one used to receive and entertain guests.
A gathering of people for a social or intellectual meeting.
An art gallery or exhibition; especially the Paris salon or autumn salon.
A beauty salon or similar establishment.
A tavern, especially in an American Old West setting.
A lounge bar in an English public house, contrasted with the public bar.
definitions.example: A pint of beer in the saloon bar costs a penny more than in the public bar.

definitions.definition: The most common body style for modern cars, with a boot or trunk.
The cabin area of a boat or yacht devoted to seated relaxation, often combined with dining table.
The part of a rail carriage or multiple unit containing seating for passengers.
Any of several flowering plants, of the genus Tragopogon, most of which have purple flowers.
Scorzonera hispanica, a plant similar in flavor to T. porrifolius, with lanceolate leaves; cultivated for its dark-skinned edible root. Known in particular as "black salsify" among other common names
The edible root of these plants.
A common substance, chemically consisting mainly of sodium chloride (NaCl), used extensively as a condiment and preservative.
One of the compounds formed from the reaction of an acid with a base, where a positive ion replaces a hydrogen of the acid.
A salt marsh, a saline marsh at the shore of a sea.
A sailor (also old salt).
Randomly chosen bytes added to a plaintext message prior to encrypting or hashing it, in order to render brute-force decryption more difficult.
A person who seeks employment at a company in order to (once employed by it) help unionize it.
Flavour; taste; seasoning.
Piquancy; wit; sense.
definitions.example: Attic salt

definitions.definition: A dish for salt at table; a salt cellar.
Skepticism and common sense.
Indignation; outrage; arguing.
To add salt to.
definitions.example: to salt fish, beef, or pork; to salt the city streets in the winter

definitions.definition: To deposit salt as a saline solution.
definitions.example: The brine begins to salt.

definitions.definition: To fill with salt between the timbers and planks, as a ship, for the preservation of the timber.
To insert or inject something into an object to give it properties it would not naturally have.
To include colorful language in.
To add filler bytes before encrypting, in order to make brute-force decryption more resource-intensive.
Salty; salted.
definitions.example: salt beef;  salt tears

definitions.definition: Saline.
definitions.example: a salt marsh;  salt grass

definitions.definition: Related to salt deposits, excavation, processing or use.
definitions.example: The salt factory is a key connecting element in the seawater infrastructure.

definitions.definition: Bitter; sharp; pungent.
Salacious; lecherous; lustful; (of animals) in heat.
Costly; expensive.

Any of the genus Atriplex of plants, especially Atriplex hortensis or Atriplex patula, found in dry habitats, that have edible leaves resembling spinach, including many desert and seashore plants and halophytes.
Any water containing dissolved salt; brine
New Keynesian or Keynesian, in reference to macroeconomics and economics departments on the East Coast and West Coast of the United States of America.
Tasting of salt.
Containing salt.
Coarse, provocative, earthy; said of language.
Experienced, especially used to indicate a veteran of the naval services; salty dog (from salt of the sea).
Irritated, annoyed (from the sharp, spicy flavor of salt).

Indignant or offended due to over-sensitivity, humourlessness, disappointment, or defeat (implying the person is a crybaby, shedding salty tears); said of interlocutors expressing indignation, or merely disagreement.

Pertaining to the Sardinian language and those dialects of Catalan, spoken in the Balearic Islands and along the coast of Catalonia, that use definitive articles descended from the Latin ipse instead of the Latin ille.
Promoting health or well-being; wholesome, especially as related to air.
A greeting, salute, or address; a hello.
The act of greeting.
Quickening; excitement.
An utterance or gesture expressing greeting or honor towards someone, now especially a formal, non-verbal gesture made with the arms or hands in any of various specific positions.
definitions.example: The soldiers greeted the dignitaries with a crisp salute.

definitions.definition: A kiss, offered in salutation.
A discharge of cannon or similar arms, as a mark of honour or respect.
A pyrotechnic device primarily designed to produce a loud bang.
To make a gesture in honor of (someone or something).
definitions.example: They saluted the flag as it passed in the parade.

definitions.definition: To act in thanks, honor, or tribute; to thank or extend gratitude; to praise.
definitions.example: I would like to salute the many dedicated volunteers that make this project possible.

definitions.definition: To wave, to acknowledge an acquaintance.
definitions.example: I saluted Bill at the concert, but he didn't see me through the crowd.

definitions.definition: To address, as with expressions of kind wishes and courtesy; to greet; to hail.
To promote the welfare and safety of; to benefit; to gratify.
To kiss.
The rescue of a ship, its crew or its cargo from a hazardous situation.
The ship, crew or cargo so rescued.
The compensation paid to the rescuers.
The money from the sale of rescued goods.
The similar rescue of property liable to loss; the property so rescued.
(sometimes attributive) Anything put to good use that would otherwise have been wasted, such as damaged goods.
definitions.example: salvage cars auction

definitions.definition: (of property, people or situations at risk) to rescue.
(of discarded goods) to put to use.
To make new or restore for the use of being saved.
An uncivilized or feral human; a barbarian.
A defiant person.
(Philippine English) summary execution, extrajudicial killing
(Philippine English) To perform summary execution.
(Philippine English) To apprehend and execute (a suspected criminal) without trial.
The process of being saved, the state of having been saved (from hell).
definitions.example: Collective salvation is not possible without personal salvation, but the latter is achievable.

definitions.definition: The process of being restored or made new for the purpose of becoming saved; the process of being rid of the old poor quality conditions and becoming improved.
To save, in the religious sense; to bring to salvation.
An ointment, cream, or balm with soothing, healing, or calming effects.
Any remedy or action that soothes or heals.
To calm or assuage.
To heal by applications or medicaments; to apply salve to; to anoint.
To heal; to remedy; to cure; to make good.
To salvage.
To save (the appearances or the phenomena); to explain (a celestial phenomenon); to account for (the apparent motions of the celestial bodies).
To resolve (a difficulty); to refute (an objection); to harmonize (an apparent contradiction).
To explain away; to mitigate; to excuse.
Hail; a greeting.
To say “salve” to; to greet; to salute.
An exception; a reservation; an excuse.
A concentrated fire from pieces of artillery, as in endeavoring to make a break in a fortification; a volley.
A salute paid by a simultaneous, or nearly simultaneous, firing of a number of cannon.
(by extension) Any volley, as in an argument or debate.
The combined cheers of a crowd.
To discharge weapons in a salvo.
A chemical element (symbol Sm) with an atomic number of 62, a moderately hard silvery metal that slowly oxidizes in air.
A Brazilian ballroom dance or dance style.
A Brazilian musical genre, to which the aforementioned dance is danced, which has its roots in West Africa via the slave trade.
To dance the samba.
Not different or other; not another or others; not different as regards self; selfsame; identical.
definitions.example: Are you the same person who phoned me yesterday?

definitions.definition: Lacking variety from; indistinguishable.
definitions.example: It took all night to find our hotel room, as we forgot our room number and each door looked the same.

definitions.definition: Similar, alike.
definitions.example: You have the same hair I do!

definitions.definition: Used to express the unity of an object or person which has various different descriptions or qualities.
definitions.example: Round here it can be cloudy and sunny even in the same day.

definitions.definition: A reply of confirmation of identity.
The identical thing, ditto.
definitions.example: It's the same everywhere.

definitions.definition: Something similar, something of the identical type.
definitions.example: She's having apple pie? I'll have the same.   You two are just the same.

definitions.definition: It or them, without a connotation of similarity.
definitions.example: Light valve suspensions and films containing UV absorbers and light valves containing the same (US Patent 5,467,217)

definitions.definition: (Indian English, common) It or them, as above, meaning the last object mentioned, mainly as complement: on the same, for the same.
definitions.example: My picture/photography blog...kindly give me your reviews on the same.

definitions.definition: Indicates the speaker's strong approval or agreement with the previous material.
Together.

A metal urn with a spigot, for boiling water for making tea. Traditionally, the water is heated by hot coals or charcoal in a chimney-like tube which runs through the center of the urn. Today, it is more likely that the water is heated by an electric coil.
A part or snippet of something taken or presented for inspection, or shown as evidence of the quality of the whole; a specimen.
definitions.example: a blood sample

definitions.definition: A subset of a population selected for measurement, observation or questioning, to provide statistical information about the population.
A small quantity of food for tasting, typically given away for free.
A small piece of some goods, for determining quality, colour, etc., typically given away for free.
Gratuitous borrowing of easily recognised phases (or moments) from other music (or movies) in a recording.
Example; pattern.
To take or to test a sample or samples of.
To reduce a continuous signal (such as a sound wave) to a discrete signal.
To reuse a portion of (an existing sound recording) in a new piece of music.
To make or show something similar to a sample.
In feudal Japan, a soldier who served a daimyo.
An institution that treats chronic diseases, and provides supervised recuperation and convalescence.
An institution that treats chronic diseases, and provides supervised recuperation and convalescence.
To make holy; to consecrate; to set aside for sacred or ceremonial use.
To free from sin; to purify.
To make acceptable or useful under religious law or practice.
To endorse with religious sanction.
Making a show of being morally better than others, especially hypocritically pious.
Holy, devout.
An approval, by an authority, generally one that makes something valid.
definitions.example: The whalers had been operating in the contested waters off the island with sanction from the Japanese government.

definitions.definition: A penalty, punishment, or some coercive measure, intended to ensure compliance; especially one adopted by several nations, or by an international body.
definitions.example: The United States enacted a new round of sanctions against the apartheid regime of South Africa.

definitions.definition: A law, treaty, or contract, or a clause within a law, treaty, or contract, specifying any of the above.
To ratify; to make valid.
To give official authorization or approval to; to countenance.
To penalize (a State etc.) with sanctions.
Holiness of life or disposition; saintliness
The condition of being considered sacred; inviolability
Something considered sacred.
A place of safety, refuge or protection.
definitions.example: My car is a sanctuary, where none can disturb me except for people who cut me off.

definitions.definition: An area set aside for protection.
definitions.example: The bird sanctuary has strict restrictions on visitors so the birds aren't disturbed.

definitions.definition: A state of being protected, asylum.
definitions.example: The government granted sanctuary to the defector, protecting him from his former government.

definitions.definition: The consecrated (or sacred) area of a church or temple around its tabernacle or altar.
Rock that is ground more finely than gravel, but is not as fine as silt (more formally, see grain sizes chart), forming beaches and deserts and also used in construction.
(often in the plural) A beach or other expanse of sand.
definitions.example: The Canadian tar sands are a promising source of oil.

definitions.definition: (circa 1920) Personal courage.
A particle from 62.5 microns to 2 mm in diameter, following the Wentworth scale.
A light beige colour, like that of typical sand.
A single grain of sand.
A moment or interval of time; the term or extent of one's life (referring to the sand in an hourglass).
Of a light beige colour, like that of typical sand.
To abrade the surface of (something) with sand or sandpaper in order to smooth or clean it.
To cover with sand.
To blot ink using sand.
A sandpiper.
A type of open shoe made up of straps or bands holding a sole to the foot
Sandalwood
A long narrow boat used on the Barbary coast.
Any of various tropical trees of the genus Santalum, native or long naturalized in India, Australia, Hawaii, and many south Pacific islands.
The aromatic heartwood of these trees used in ornamental carving, in the construction of insect-repellent boxes and chests, and as a source of certain perfumes.
A sturdy sack filled with sand, generally used in large numbers to make defensive walls against flooding, bullets, or shrapnel.
A small bag filled with sand and used as a cudgel.
An engraver's leather cushion, etc.
A deceptive play whereby a player with a strong hand bets weakly or passively.
To construct a barrier of sandbags around.
definitions.example: We sandbagged the basement windows against the floodwaters.

definitions.definition: To strike someone with a sandbag or other object to disable or render unconscious.
To conceal or misrepresent one's true position, potential, or intent in order to gain an advantage.
Sand driven by a blast of air or steam for cutting and engraving figures on glass or metal.

To spray with fast-moving solid grains (such as sand propelled by compressed air, although softer material like sodium bicarbonate used for delicate materials may also be so referred to). The process is used for stripping dirt, rust, paint etc. from the surface of objects.
A small wading bird, Calidris alba, that breeds in the Arctic and winters on sandy shores and estuaries around the world. A type of stint.
A dune.
A sandhill crane, Grus canadensis.
A legendary figure who is said to bring good sleep and dreams by sprinkling magical sand into people's eyes.
Used as a symbol of the passage of time toward death.
A strong paper coated with sand, ground glass, or other abrasive material for smoothing and polishing.
A sheet of such paper.
To polish or grind (a surface) with or as if with sandpaper.
Any of various small wading birds of the family Scolopacidae.
A sedimentary rock produced by the consolidation and compaction of sand, cemented with clay etc.
A dish or foodstuff where two or more slices of bread serve as the wrapper or container of some other food.
(by extension) Any combination formed by layering one type of material between two layers of some other material.
A layer cake or sandwich cake.
To place one item between two other, usually flat, items
To put or set something between two others, in time.
Of a meal or serving size that is smaller than a dinner.
Covered with sand.
Sprinkled with sand.
Containing sand.
definitions.example: Some plants grow best in sandy soil.

definitions.definition: Like sand, especially in texture.
Having the colour of sand.
Being in a healthy condition; not deranged; thinking rationally.

definitions.definition: Mentally sound; possessing a rational mind; having the mental faculties in such condition as to be able to anticipate and judge the effect of one's actions in an ordinary manner.

definitions.definition: Rational; reasonable; sensible.
definitions.example: Try to go to bed at a sane time before your exams.

definitions.definition: To produce musical or harmonious sounds with one’s voice.
definitions.example: "I really want to sing in the school choir," said Vera.

definitions.definition: To express audibly by means of a harmonious vocalization.
To soothe with singing.
definitions.example: to sing somebody to sleep

definitions.definition: To confess under interrogation.
To make a small, shrill sound.

definitions.definition: To relate in verse; to celebrate in poetry.
To display fine qualities; to stand out as excellent.
definitions.example: The sauce really makes this lamb sing.

definitions.definition: To be capable of being sung; to produce a certain effect by being sung.

A Chinese wind instrument, a free-reed mouth organ consisting of 13 or more bamboo pipes of various lengths, which are fixed at their bases in a wind chest made from a dried gourd (or, more recently, wood or chrome-plated brass).
A mixed drink common in the West Indies, similar to sangria and usually featuring wine or fortified wine and spices.
To drink sangaree.
To prepare sangaree.
A bloodthirsty person.
The plant common yarrow, or herba sanguinaria (Achillea millefolium).
(of an event) Involving bloodshed.

(of an object) Consisting of, covered with, or similar in appearance to blood.
Blood colour; red.
Anything of a blood-red colour, as cloth.
A tincture, seldom used, of a blood-red colour (not to be confused with murrey).
Bloodstone.
Red crayon.
To stain with blood; to impart the colour of blood to; to ensanguine.
Having the colour of blood; blood red.

Having a bodily constitution characterised by a preponderance of blood over the other bodily humours, thought to be marked by irresponsible mirth; indulgent in pleasure to the exclusion of important matters.
Characterized by abundance and active circulation of blood.

definitions.definition: Warm; ardent.

definitions.definition: Anticipating the best; optimistic; confident; full of hope.

definitions.definition: Full of blood; bloody.
Bloodthirsty.
Accompanied by bloodshed; bloody.
Eager for bloody violence; bloodthirsty.
Resembling or constituting blood.
Any of several plants, of the genus Sanicula, having palmate compound leaves and small flowers arranged in umbels; the snakeroot.
An institution that treats chronic diseases, and provides supervised recuperation and convalescence.
Sanitary towel.
Of, or relating to health.
Clean and free from pathogens; hygienic.
(heading, physical) To move or be moved into something.
(heading, social) To diminish or be diminished.
To conceal and appropriate.
To keep out of sight; to suppress; to ignore.
To pay absolutely.

definitions.definition: To reduce or extinguish by payment.

definitions.definition: To be overwhelmed or depressed; to fail in strength.
To decrease in volume, as a river; to subside; to become diminished in volume or in apparent height.
Short for sans serif.
Without; lacking
A letter of the Archaic Greek alphabet (uppercase Ϻ, lowercase ϻ) that came after pi and before qoppa.
A sanatorium.
An intelligent, self-aware being.
Attempting to appear wise or discerning.
Possessing wisdom and discernment; wise, learned.
Of a species or life-form, possessing intelligence or self-awareness.
A young tree, but bigger than a seedling.
A youngster, especially a male nearing maturity.
To convert (a fat or oil) into soap.
To be converted into soap.
To hydrolyze (an ester) using an alkali.
A clear deep blue variety of corundum, valued as a precious stone.
A white, yellow, or purple variety of corundum, either clear or translucent.
A deep blue colour.
Any hummingbird in the genera Hylocharis and Chlorestes, as well as the rufous-throated sapphire, which is now in the genus Amazilia.
Any of the butterflies in the southern Asian lycaenid genus Heliophorus.
Of a deep blue colour.
Pertaining to a 45th year
Excessively sweet, emotional, nostalgic; cheesy; mushy. (British equivalent: soppy)
definitions.example: It was a sappy love song, but it reminded them of their first dance.

definitions.definition: Having (a particularly large amount of) sap.
Juicy.
(of wood) Spongy; Having spaces in which large quantities of sap can flow.
Musty; tainted; rancid.
Any organism that lives on dead organic matter, as certain fungi and bacteria
A woodpecker of the eastern United States (of the genus Sphyrapicus) that feeds mainly on the sap of trees
Any woodpecker that punctures the bark of trees and feeds upon the sap.
A plastic resin used to make packaging films.
Use of acerbic language to mock or convey contempt, often using irony and (in speech) often marked by overemphasis and a sneering tone of voice.
definitions.example: Sarcasm is the lowest form of wit.

definitions.definition: An act of sarcasm.
Containing sarcasm.

definitions.definition: (of a person) Having the personality trait of expressing sarcasm.
A type of malignant tumor of the bone, cartilage, fat, muscle, blood vessels, or other connective or supportive tissue.
A stone coffin, often inscribed or decorated with sculpture.
The cement and steel structure that encases the destroyed reactor at the power station in Chernobyl, Ukraine.
A kind of limestone used by the Greeks for coffins, so called because it was thought to consume the flesh of corpses.
An 18th-century form of wine cooler.

Any one of several species of small herring which are commonly preserved in olive oil or in tins for food, especially the pilchard, or European sardine Sardina pilchardus (syn. Clupea pilchardus). The California sardine Sardinops sagax (syn. Clupea sagax) is similar. The American sardines of the Atlantic coast are mostly the young of the Atlantic herring and of the menhaden.
Carnelian
Someone packed or crammed into a small space.
To fish for sardines
To pack or cram together tightly.
Scornfully mocking or cynical.
definitions.example: He distances himself from people with his nasty, sardonic laughter.

definitions.definition: Disdainfully or ironically humorous.

The traditional dress of women in the Indian Subcontinent; an outer garment consisting of a single length of cotton or silk, most often with one end wrapped around the waist to form a skirt, the other draped over the shoulder or head.
A garment made of a length of printed cloth wrapped about the waist that is commonly worn by men and women in Malaysia, Sri Lanka, India, Indonesia, and the Pacific islands.
Any of various tropical (Central and South) American vines of the genus Smilax, such as Smilax regelii, which have fragrant roots.
The dried roots of these plants, or a flavoring material extracted from these roots.
A beverage (soft drink) flavored with this root, such as root beer.
Any of several North American plants, of the genus Aralia, having umbels and small white flowers.
A piece of cloth designed to be worn around the waist.
A decorative length of cloth worn over the shoulder to the opposite hip, often for ceremonial or other formal occasions.
To adorn with a sash.
The opening part (casement) of a window usually containing the glass panes, hinged to the jamb, or sliding up and down as in a sash window.
A draggable vertical or horizontal bar used to adjust the relative sizes of two adjacent windows.
In a sawmill, the rectangular frame in which the saw is strained and by which it is carried up and down with a reciprocating motion; the gate.
To furnish with a sash.
A chassé.
A sequence of sideways steps in a circle in square dancing.
To walk casually, showily or in a flirty manner; to strut, swagger or flounce.
To chassé when dancing.
To move sideways.
A dish consisting of thin slices or pieces of raw fish or meat.
A tree of species Sassafras albidum of the eastern United States and Asia having mitten-shaped leaves and red, aromatic heartwood.
A tree of any species in the genus Sassafras.
The bark of the root of this plant, used for medicinal and (mostly historically) culinary purposes and formerly a main ingredient in root beer.
Of, pertaining to or resembling Satan (the Devil).

definitions.definition: Evil, fiendish, devilish or diabolical.
Of or pertaining to any form of Satanism.
A moon or other smaller body orbiting a larger one.
definitions.example: A spent upper stage is a derelict satellite.

definitions.definition: A man-made apparatus designed to be placed in orbit around a celestial body, generally to relay information, data etc. to Earth.
definitions.example: Many telecommunication satellites orbit at 36000km above the equator.

definitions.definition: A country, state, office, building etc. which is under the jurisdiction, influence, or domination of another body.
An attendant on an important person; a member of someone's retinue, often in a somewhat derogatory sense; a henchman.
Satellite TV; reception of television broadcasts via services that utilize man-made satellite technology.
definitions.example: Do you have satellite at your house?

definitions.definition: (grammar) A grammatical construct that takes various forms and may encode a path of movement, a change of state, or the grammatical aspect. Examples: "a bird flew past"; "she turned on the light".
To transmit by satellite.
Capable of being sated, satisfiable.
definitions.example: The god's demand for blood was satiable only by the sacrifice of a virgin.

definitions.definition: To fill to satisfaction; to satisfy.
definitions.example: Nothing seemed to satiate her desire for knowledge.

definitions.definition: To satisfy to excess. To fill to satiety.
Filled to satisfaction or to excess.
The state of being satiated.
definitions.example: Eating half of that loaf of bread has left me in a state of utter satiety.

definitions.definition: A cloth woven from silk, nylon or polyester with a glossy surface and a dull back. (The same weaving technique applied to cotton produces cloth termed sateen).
To make (paper, silver, etc.) smooth and glossy like satin.
Semigloss.
definitions.example: satin paint

definitions.definition: A literary device of writing or art which principally ridicules its subject often as an intended means of provoking or preventing change. Humor, irony, and exaggeration are often used to aid this.
A satirical work.
definitions.example: a stinging satire of American politics.

definitions.definition: Severity of remark.
Of or pertaining to satire
A fulfilment of a need or desire.
definitions.example: He enjoyed the dish with great satisfaction. He'll order it again the next time he arrives.

definitions.definition: The pleasure obtained by such fulfillment.
The source of such gratification.
A reparation for an injury or loss.
A vindication for a wrong suffered.
definitions.example: The count demanded satisfaction in the form of a duel at dawn.

definitions.definition: Done to satisfaction; adequate or sufficient.
definitions.example: The satisfactory results of the survey led to his promotion.

definitions.definition: Causing satisfaction; agreeable or pleasant; satisfying.
Making atonement for a sin; expiatory.
To do enough for; to meet the needs of; to fulfill the wishes or requirements of.
definitions.example: I'm not satisfied with the quality of the food here.

definitions.definition: To cause (a sentence) to be true when the sentence is interpreted in one's universe.
To convince by ascertaining; to free from doubt.
To pay to the extent of what is claimed or due.
definitions.example: to satisfy a creditor

definitions.definition: To answer or discharge (a claim, debt, legal demand, etc.); to give compensation for.
definitions.example: to satisfy a claim or an execution

definitions.definition: Capable of being saturated, of achieving saturation
Something saturated, especially a saturated fat.
To cause to become completely impregnated, or soaked (especially with a liquid).
definitions.example: After walking home in the driving rain, his clothes were saturated.

definitions.definition: To fill to excess.
definitions.example: Modern television is saturated with violence.

definitions.definition: To satisfy the affinity of; to cause a substance to become inert by chemical combination with all that it can hold.
definitions.example: One can saturate phosphorus with chlorine.

definitions.definition: To render pure, or of a colour free from white light.
Saturated; wet.
Very intense.
definitions.example: saturate green

definitions.definition: A period or occasion of general license, in which the passions or vices have riotous indulgence; a period of unrestrained revelry.
Of a person: having a tendency to be cold, bitter, gloomy, sarcastic, and slow to change and react.
Of a setting: depressing, dull, gloomy.
Of, pertaining to, or containing lead (which was symbolically associated with the planet Saturn by alchemists).
Of a disease: caused by lead poisoning (saturnism); of a person: affected by lead poisoning.
Pertaining to the astrological influence of the planet Saturn; having the characteristics of a person under such influence (see sense 1).
A woodland creature with pointed ears, legs, and short horns of a goat and a fondness for unrestrained revelry.
Any of various nymphalid butterflies of the genus Faunis.

A sylvan deity or demigod, male companion of Pan or Dionysus, represented as part man and part goat, and characterized by riotous merriment and lasciviousness, sometimes pictured with a perpetual erection.
(by extension) A lecherous man.
Any of various butterflies of the nymphalid subfamily Satyrinae, having brown wings marked with eyelike spots; a meadow brown.
The orangutan.
A liquid (often thickened) condiment or accompaniment to food.

definitions.definition: Tomato sauce (similar to US tomato ketchup), as in:

definitions.definition: (usually “the”) Alcohol, booze.

A soft crayon for use in stump drawing or in shading with the stump.
Cheek; impertinence; backtalk; sass.
(1800s) Vegetables.
Any garden vegetables eaten with meat.
To add sauce to; to season.
To cause to relish anything, as if with a sauce; to tickle or gratify, as the palate; to please; to stimulate.
To make poignant; to give zest, flavour or interest to; to set off; to vary and render attractive.
To treat with bitter, pert, or tart language; to be impudent or saucy to.
The person, place or thing from which something (information, goods, etc.) comes or is acquired.

Source code.
The name of one terminal of a field effect transistor (FET).
A deep cooking vessel with a handle and sometimes a lid; used for boiling, stewing and making sauces.
Similar to sauce; having the consistency or texture of sauce.
Impertinent or disrespectful, often in a manner that is regarded as entertaining or amusing; smart.

definitions.definition: Impudently bold; pert.
Sharp; pungent; piquant.
Mildly erotic.

A German person.
A room or a house designed for heat sessions.

To use a sauna.
Sandalwood.
A leisurely walk or stroll.
A leisurely pace.
A place for sauntering or strolling.
To stroll, or walk at a leisurely pace.
A food made of ground meat (or meat substitute) and seasoning, packed in a section of the animal's intestine, or in a similarly cylindrical shaped synthetic casing; a length of this food.
A sausage-shaped thing.
Penis.
A term of endearment.

definitions.definition: A saucisse.
To form a sausage-like shape, with a non-uniform cross section.
To cook (food) using a small amount of fat in an open pan over a relatively high heat, allowing the food to brown and form a crust stopping it from sticking to the pan as it cooks.
An uncivilized or feral human; a barbarian.
A defiant person.
To attack or assault someone or something ferociously or without restraint.

definitions.definition: To criticise vehemently.

definitions.definition: (of an animal) To attack with the teeth.
To make savage.
Wild; not cultivated.

definitions.definition: Barbaric; not civilized.

definitions.definition: Fierce and ferocious.

definitions.definition: Brutal, vicious or merciless.

definitions.definition: Unpleasant or unfair.
Great, brilliant, amazing.

definitions.definition: Nude; naked.
Savage or brutal behaviour; barbarity.
A violent act of cruelty.
Savages collectively; the world of savages.
Wild growth of plants.
A tropical grassland with scattered trees
A person of learning, especially one who is versed in literature or science.
A person who is considered eminent because of their achievements.
A person with significant mental disabilities who is very gifted in one area of activity, such as playing the piano or mental arithmetic.
In various sports, a block that prevents an opponent from scoring.

definitions.example: Jones retired seven to earn the save.

definitions.definition: A point in a professional wrestling match when one or more wrestlers run to the ring to aid a fellow wrestler who is being beaten.
definitions.example: The giant wrestler continued to beat down his smaller opponent, until several wrestlers ran in for the save.

definitions.definition: The act, process, or result of saving data to a storage medium.
definitions.example: If you're hit by a power cut, you'll lose all of your changes since your last save.

definitions.definition: A saving throw.
To prevent harm or difficulty.
To put aside, to avoid.
Except; with the exception of.
Unless; except
A person who saves someone, rescues another from harm.
A child who is born to provide an organ or cell transplant to a sibling who has an otherwise fatal disease (used in combination, with "sibling", "baby", "child", "brother", "sister", etc.)
